title: Accordion
description: Collapsible Q&A component for FAQs, feature details, and content organization with single-open, multi-open, or static behavior modes.

metadata.description: Accessible accordion component with collapsible panels for organizing FAQ sections, feature details, and expandable content. Critical for objection handling and conversion optimization on marketing sites.

accessibility.focusManagement: Focus remains on trigger button after toggle. Arrow keys navigate between items.

usageExamples.title: Pricing FAQ (Single-Open)

usageExamples.title: Product FAQ (Multi-Open)

usageExamples.description: Feature expansion with icon on left side for visual variety

title.description: Optional section title displayed above accordion

items.description: Array of accordion items (questions and answers)

id.description: Unique identifier for the item (used for ARIA and deep linking)

question.description: Question text displayed in the trigger button

answer.description: Answer content (plain text or HTML). Supports paragraph tags, lists, links, etc.

defaultOpen.description: Whether this item starts in the open state

behavior.description: Accordion behavior: 'single' = only one open at a time (true accordion), 'multi' = multiple can be open (toggle), 'static' = all open by default (no collapse)

variant.description: Visual style variant: 'default' = standard borders, 'bordered' = thick borders with highlight, 'card' = elevated with shadows, 'minimal' = borderless with dividers

grouped.description: Whether items are grouped by category (uses categories prop instead of items)

categories.description: Category groups when grouped=true. Each category contains a title and items array.

items.description: Array of accordion items in this category (same structure as root items)

id.description: Unique identifier for the component instance

marketingContext.conversionImpact: HIGH - Critical for reducing pre-purchase friction and checkout abandonment
useCases: Pre-purchase objection handling (place before final CTA)
Pricing page FAQ to reduce sales inquiry volume
Legal content (terms, privacy policy) progressive disclosure
bestPractices: Lead with most common questions first (use analytics to prioritize)
Keep answers concise (2-3 sentences) with links to detailed pages
Use reassuring, non-defensive tone in answers
Include social proof when relevant ('10,000+ customers trust us')
Single-open behavior reduces cognitive load for scanning
Place FAQ before final CTA to address last-minute objections
Use schema.org FAQPage markup for Google rich snippets
psychologyPrinciples: Objection Handling: Every unanswered question is a potential lost sale
Progressive Disclosure: Reduce overwhelming information by hiding details until needed
Trust Building: Transparency about policies builds confidence
Friction Reduction: Answer questions before users need to ask (reduces support tickets by 45%)
